data.title: Allow for short hand hex colors
data.body:
re #25328

When specifying colors in for html/css you can abbreviate `#00000` as `#000`. It would be nice we support that as well

data.title: A context menu action or a command to do ts check on a javascript file?
data.body:
Testing #25322 

A context menu action or a command to do ts check on a javascript file?

data.title: Not possible to drag and drop selection between editors
data.body:
Refs: #25338

insiders, os x

1. Enable editor drag and drop, have two editor open side by side
2. Try to drag some selection from one editor to the second -> does not work

I would expect this to work as it is one of the mayor use cases for this feature. This nicely works in sublime.

![dnd](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/25426566/e7010166-2a6f-11e7-88f8-2879ef4469aa.gif)

data.title: Unable to bind Ctrl+shift+2 under Ubuntu

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Linux tk9 4.4.0-71-generic #92-Ubuntu SMP Fri Mar 24 12:59:01 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

This is specific OS/single setup issue, since I was not able to reproduce it on OSX, Windows and other people on other Linux

1. Disable all extensions and custom settings on Ubuntu
2. Add new keybinding:
```
{
    {
        "key": "ctrl+shift+1",
        "command": "workbench.action.terminal.focusPrevious"
    },
    {
        "key": "ctrl+shift+2",
        "command": "workbench.action.terminal.focusNext"
    }
}
```
2. Open 2 integrated terminals
3. `ctrl+shift+1` rolling between terminals, `ctrl+shift+2` is not.
4. If you bind `ctrl+shift+3` for `focusNext` - it works.

[Discussion in VIM plugin repository](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/issues/1489)

data.title: What are buttonXYZ colors?
data.body:
re #25328

I have added below config, the doc leaves me clueless and the I also don't see a visual change

```json
    "workbench.colorCustomizations": {
        "buttonBackground": "#00FF00",
        "buttonForeground": "#CCCCCC",
        "buttonHoverBackground": "#FF0000"
    }
```

![screen shot 2017-04-26 at 10 58 04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1794099/25426388/3d4977b6-2a6f-11e7-98fe-6d72e701f84b.png)

data.title: Editor drag and drop mouse feedback missing
data.body:
Refs: #25338

OS X, insider

1. Enable editor drag and drop and select some text
2. Drag that text
3. Notice that the editor cursor nicely updates however the mouse cursor does not update to reflect that I am dropping something. This leaves me puzzled as the user what is going on as there is no prominent feedback that I am actually dragging the text in the editor

It would be great if we could fix this as it would greatly increase the experinece imho
Notice in the gif that I am dragging the text all the time while the mouse is unchanged

![dnd](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/25426320/03ffde14-2a6f-11e7-9482-9e3274d2df66.gif)

data.title: Previews are not full screen
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.11.2 - OS Version: OS X 10.12.3 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open Visual Studio 2. Open any kind of preview (markdown, extensions and so on)

data.title: Multiple column breakpoints that get folded together remain "duplicated"
data.body:
Testing #25194

Have the following source code:

```
function fib(n) { if ((n === 1) || (n === 0)) { return 1; } else { return fib(n - 1) + fib(n - 2); } }
console.log(fib(10));
```

Use `Shift+F9` to add N breakpoints, in between each letter on the fib line (about 100). Use https://nodejs.org/download/nightly/v8.0.0-nightly201703249ff7ed23cd/

Press play without a debug configuration. Notice that the breakpoints have been folded together in the editor, and pressing F5 acts as if there would be a single breakpoint at a position, but the breakpoint list shows many "duplicated" breakpoints:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/25426113/65d2c242-2a6e-11e7-9e10-e34499aef36a.png)

data.title: New log files are created after changing the log settings
data.body:
Testing #25334

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Change the `typescript.tsserver.log` setting to `verbose`
2. Open the logs
3. Stop the logging `Off`
4. Restart ts server
5. Change again to `verbose`
6. Open the log

- You see a new log file.
Why is it not shown in the same log file?

data.title: Editor drag n drop: unable to duplicate selection sometimes
data.body:
Refs: #25338

os x, insiders

1. Enable drag and drop in editor and select something
2. Move the cursor one line up or down and hold the option key and drop
3. Notice the whole selection is moved one line down, it is not duplicated as I would expect since I am holding the option key

Please note that his is not happening 100% time but I get it seldomly to happen. Notice in this gif I had to do it 2 times in order to catch it.

![dnd](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/25426040/34ab0fd0-2a6e-11e7-824c-a2b90b700bf5.gif)

data.title: consider to support "nvm" in node-debug extension

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Many users are managing their installed node versions via "nvm".
But it seems to be difficult to make VS Code use the node version installed by "nvm". 

To simplify this we could directly support "nvm" in node-debug launch configurations e.g. by adding an optional "nvm" attribute that takes a version specifier:

![2017-04-26_10-49-42](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/25425996/12060e4e-2a6e-11e7-890e-d49c0d7d462f.png)

(for lengthy discussion see see https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1895)

Opinions?

data.title: Settings editor gets emptied
data.body:
Since a couple of days (actually might be weeks) I often see the right hand side of the settings editor turn completely empty. This typically happens when switching between tabs and then later coming back to the editor:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/25425821/757cc39c-2a6d-11e7-9939-7aa01e54bf82.png)

in this case what I did was:
* change some settings
* open a file to the side
* click on another tab (settings got hidden)
* start a search
* click back to settings

Not sure yet how to reproduce better though.

data.title: A command to restart the typescript server
data.body:
Testing #25334 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use the command Typescript: Select Typescript version to change the version of typescript server running
2. Choose to restart the server later in the notification

I do not see any command / way to restart the type script server after I miss the above notification.
I also think it is helpful to provide this command in general

data.title: Restarting type script server after changing the version shows an error in the log
data.body:
Testing #25334 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Use the command `Typescript: Select Typescript version` to change the version of typescript server running
2. Restart the typescript server

Observer in logs that 
`[Error - 10:25:55 AM] TSServer exited with code: unknown`

This is not an error as user restarted it purposefully.

data.title: Make Ctrl+D word expansion user configurable

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.0-insider
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Go to a css file.
2. have a `.foo { property-with-dash: value }`.
3. put cursor anywhere in "property".
4. `ctrl-d`.
5. Selection is from property to dash, including dashes.

What I expected: Selection would be only on the word I was on, dashes acting as delimiter, like space.

data.title: infoBackground needs better name
data.body:
I first though 'infoBackground' would be the color of the message dialog.
From looking at the code it looks like its bound to the input dialog. So what about inputValidationInfoBackground?

data.title: "Go To Next Error" steals focus until esc is pressed
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.0
- OS Version: MacOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click F8 (Or whichever shortcut) to "Go To Next Error"
2. You would ideally be able to click shortcut for "quick fix" or type in to fix but you have to press ESC first to return focus to editor. That's an annoyance.

data.title: Changing Themes Resets Extension Page CSS
data.body: **steps** 1. Open an extension page 1. Change color theme **Bug** Notice that the font is reset to a serif-font and some other custom styling is lost This is a content security provider issue. When you change a theme, we attempt to dynamically add new css to the extension view page. The current CSP blocks this untrusted new css **Impact** Minor. Loading a new extension page fixes this. Also unlikely to be hit in regular workflows

data.title: Solarized Light - Title Bar Text Is Not Legible on MacOS
data.body: **Bug** The title bar is a deep blue color which makes the dark gray text of the title bar almost invisible

Any tips?
